First full day of summer brings searing heat in Mass.

Boston already hit 90 degrees and temperatures could reach close to 100 this afternoon. (Boston.com, 12:20 p.m.)

Spokesman: Senator Brown misspoke
in claiming meetings with royalty

Brown's spokesman said in an e-mail, “Senator Brown was speaking generally about private meetings he has had with foreign and domestic leaders.” (Globe, 12:35 p.m.)
  • Warren argues Brown would weaken Wall Street reform

The Brigham implants first total artificial heart in New England

The first total artificial heart implant in New England was performed last February on a 66-year-old man from the South Shore. (Globe, 10:14 a.m.)
  • About heart transplants  |  More health, fitness news

Police pull body from Charles River

The body of a man was recovered this morning from the Charles River in Boston near the Longfellow Bridge, State Police said. (Globe , 10:14 a.m.)

Officials accuse Rep. Daniel Webster, an attorney, of misusing client funds

Webster, a ranking Republican in the state House who had his law license suspended, has been accused of intentionally misusing client funds. (Globe, 12:42 p.m.)

Two arrested at Logan on drug charges

A man and a woman were arrested after one was found to have 500 grams of prescription painkillers and the other $9,000 in cash, prosecutors said. (Globe, 11:23 a.m.)

Judge throws out 3 of 51 counts against Jerry Sandusky

The judge overseeing Sandusky's child sex abuse trial has thrown out three of the 51 charges in the case, leaving the former Penn State assistant football coach facing 48 counts.

Business

70 the new age to retire?

It’s official. When it comes to retiring, 70 is the new 65. That’s according to a study from Boston College’s Center for Retirement Research that shows fewer than half of US workers will have enough money saved to retire at 65.
